Package moblima.Entity

Class DayType

java.lang.Object
moblima.Entity.DayType
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class DayType extends Object implements Serializable
Class DayType holds all the price proportions tied to the corresponding daytypes.
Since:
2022-11-13
Version:
1.0
Author:
Yap Shen Hwei

    delKey(String dayName)
    Deletes a specified day type from dayType, if not found, since remove() returns Null if key not found, the function throws a NullPointerException.

  • Method Details

    • getAllExistingKeys

      public ArrayList<String> getAllExistingKeys()
      getAllExistingKeys() returns the set of all keys stored in the LinkedHashMap. This is useful in scenarios where a list of options need to be presented on an UI.
      Returns:
      an array of keys of dayType

    • getKey

      public String getKey(int i)
      Gets the key according to the index
      Returns:
      day key string

    • getPriceProportion

      public double getPriceProportion(String dayName)
      Returns the price proportion corresponding to the DayType
      Returns:
      priceProportion

    • setAddPriceProportion

      public void setAddPriceProportion(String dayName, double newPrice)
      Mutator for setting price proportion and adding price proportion dayName is made all caps, and any space is replaced with '_'
      Parameters:
      dayName -
      newPrice -

    • delKey

      public void delKey(String dayName) throws NullPointerException
      Deletes a specified day type from dayType, if not found, since remove() returns Null if key not found, the function throws a NullPointerException. It saves the new predefined dayType dictionary where the specified type is removed.
      Parameters:
      dayName -
      Throws:
      NullPointerException

    • getDayList

      public LinkedHashMap<String,Double> getDayList()
      Returns the LinkedHashMap containing the daytypes and their corresponding price proportion.
      Returns:
      dayType

    • printDayType

      public void printDayType()
      Prints the day type structure so that staff can view the different days and their corresponding price proportion.
